sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
A briefe description of the portes, creekes, bayes, and hauens, of the Weast India: translated out of the Castlin tongue by I.F. The originall whereof was directed to the mightie Prince Don Charles, King of Castile, &c. Suma de geographia que trata de todas las particlas & provinces del mundo: en especial de las Indias. English Enciso, Martin Fernández de, d. 1525. Frampton, John, fl. 1577-1596.
[6], 27, [3] p.
By Henry Bynneman, Imprinted at London : Anno. 1578.
Translation of a part of: Enciso, Martin Fernández de. Suma de geographia que trata de todas las particlas & provinces del mundo: en especial de las Indias. Translator's dedication signed: John Frampton. The last leaf is blank. Running title reads: Of all the portes, creekes, and hauens of the Weast India. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
A briefe description of the portes, creekes, bayes, and hauens, of the Weast India: translated out of the Castlin tongue by I.F. The originall whereof was directed to the mightie Prince Don Charles, King of Castile, &c. Suma de geographia que trata de todas las particlas & provinces del mundo: en especial de las Indias. English Enciso, Martin Fernández de, d. 1525. Frampton, John, fl. 1577-1596.
[6], 27, [3] p.
By Henry Bynneman, Imprinted at London : Anno. 1578.
Translation of a part of: Enciso, Martin Fernández de. Suma de geographia que trata de todas las particlas & provinces del mundo: en especial de las Indias. Translator's dedication signed: John Frampton. The last leaf is blank. Running title reads: Of all the portes, creekes, and hauens of the Weast India. Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
Henry Bynneman
